intro: Tubella membraniflora, commonly known as the membranous-flowered tubella, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, membranous petals that give it its common name. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and has a short flowering period. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for botanists studying plant morphology and adaptation.
